title: Industrial Engineer ( PROGS)
job_desc:
Teradyne is looking for talented people, who share our passion and drive, to join our team. Our customers are the worlds leading electronics companies and they depend on us to help them get quality products to market. At Teradyne, we ride the wave of technological innovation every day. Its an exciting business! If being part of a global team is something that excites you, Teradyne may be the place for you.

Basic Duties And Responsibilities

  • Developing and Implementing Process Improvements: Analyze existing processes and identify areas for improvement. Design and implement changes to enhance efficiency and productivity.
  • Designing Efficient Production Processes: Lead or support the creation of production layouts and workflows that maximize efficiency and minimize waste. The goal is to optimize resource utilization and reduce unnecessary steps in the production cycle.
  • Quality Control and Cost Reduction: Work to maintain quality standards while minimizing costs. This involves evaluating material usage, production methods, and equipment efficiency.
  • Designing Control Systems: Develop control systems to help manage costs, production issues, and quality control. These systems help streamline operations and improve overall performance.

Requirements And Skills

  • Education : A degree in Industrial Engineering or a related field is preferred.
  • Work Experience : Proven experience as an Industrial Engineer or in a similar role.
  • Technical Knowledge : Advanced knowledge and understanding of Industrial Engineering tools and methodologies.
  • Problem-solving skills : Critical thinking and the ability to address operational challenges.
  • Communication : Strong communication and presentation abilities.
  • Attention to Detail : A keen eye for identifying inefficiencies and areas for improvement.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

title: Management Program / Industrial Engineer / Finance / Accounting
job_desc:
PLEASE READ: BE SURE YOU FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS BELOW UNDER "HOW TO APPLY". WE ONLY REVIEW COMPLETE APPLICATIONS.

ABOUT US

Transporitfy is Southeast Asia&aposs leading trucking, road cargo and goods delivery provider operating in Indonesia, Philippines and Thailand. In other countries we are known as "Deliveree." Our asset light business is powered by evolving third-generation technology, a massive marketplace of vendors, a robust roster of multinational and SME customers and our team&aposs deep commitment to operational excellence.

Transportify is operating in Luzon, Visayas and Mindanao. We are looking for energetic individuals to join our team.

SUMMARY OF OPPORTUNITY

We are searching for industrial engineering and accounting/finance graduates to join our management program (other engineering courses are welcome to apply). Our company is a logistics technology company and we believe that the skills learned by engineering graduates are easily adaptable to the skills required by many roles in our company.

Since we view engineers and finance/accounting graduates as easily adaptable for many roles in our company, our interview process carefully assesses the strengths and objectives of the candidate. Then we match the candidate with rotations that develop the candidate&aposs analytical skills (data analysis skills) and that allow us to create a career path that leverages the candidate&aposs strengths. The rotations will be fast-paced, intense and challenging; but benefitting directly from the company&aposs fast-paced growth.

The role is ideal for individuals who fresh graduates who are hungry for growth want to hit the ground running.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • We prefer fresh or graduates. We look for high achievement / overachievement in university (engineering/accounting/finance courses preferred).
  • Ability to self-manage without daily micromanagement
  • Hunger and drive to achieve superior results. Strong work ethic.
  • Prior industry experience not required - we prefer raw talent

HOW TO APPLY [Very Important!]

Congratulations, most people don&apost read this far down. Please write a cover email to Paulo at [HIDDEN TEXT] and attach the following documents:

1. PDF resume

2. Completed Pre-Interview Form - you can download the form at the following link -> https://bit.ly/seniorcoodinator-preform

Applications that do not follow the instructions above will not be considered.

title: Industrial Engineer
job_desc:
Key Responsibilities:

  • Analyze production processes and workflows to identify areas for improvement and implement best practices.
  • Lead Kaizen events and workshops to foster a culture of continuous improvement within the organization.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and implement lean methodologies and process optimization strategies.
  • Utilize data analysis tools and techniques to assess performance metrics and drive decision-making.
  • Prepare and present reports on project status, improvement initiatives, and key performance indicators to management.
  • Conduct time studies and capacity analyses to optimize resource allocation and reduce waste.
  • Support the development of training materials and conduct training sessions on lean practices and process improvements.
  • Ensure compliance with safety, quality, and regulatory standards in all engineering projects.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Industrial Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, or a related field.
  • 2-3 years of experience in industrial engineering, process improvement, or a related role.
  • Kaizen certification or equivalent experience in continuous improvement methodologies.
  • Proficient in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Microsoft Excel, Minitab).
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically under pressure.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse teams.
  • Knowledge of lean manufacturing principles and techniques.

title: Industrial Engineer
job_desc:
Major Functions

  1. Apply methodology and conduct studies to improve practices and performance in the DC.
  2. Provide projects to improve DC Performance related to SQSCP.

Duties and Responsibilities

  1. Identifies and executes valuable projects that could contribute convenience to co-employee.
  2. Performs assessment on operational violations based on known policies and procedures.
  3. Ensures updated standard DC procedures as scheduled.
  4. Assists standards and control head in implementing business continuity plan simulation.
  5. Performs productivity studies in order to quantify duration of a certain process made.
  6. Provide and implement new procedures that could simplify existing processes and promote effective operational productivity.
  7. Perform assessment on operational violations based on known policies and procedures, management, quality and GWP audit.
  8. Acts as training guide for newly implemented system approach and ensure accuracy of information given to end-users.
  9. Monitors and reviews existing and newly implemented procedures. Draw feedback that could further enhance the operation.
  10. Ensure on time submission of FSC Scorecard (Productivity, Profiling, OCR etc).
  11. On time closure of assigned error logs based on lead time set on error logs monitoring.
  12. Attend and on time closure of actions assigned on DOR and PISM Meeting .
  13. Maintain cleanliness and orderliness of the work place and actively participate in all programs set by the management.
  14. Perform other duties as maybe assigned from time to time by their immediate superior.

Professional Qualifications

  1. College graduate of any 5 year engineering course, preferably fresh graduate of Industrial Engineering.
  2. Possess above average in communication, presentation, problem solving, logical and analytical skills.
  3. Computer Literate (word, excel, PowerPoint)

Personal Qualifications

  1. Proactive, Innovative, Creative, Flexible, Non-bias and can easily adapt to changes, committed and result oriented.
  2. Must have good communication and interpersonal skills
  3. With good leadership skills

title: Industrial Engineer - Business Process
job_desc:
Role Description

The role involves tasks such as utilizing analytical skills, implementing industrial engineering principles, effective communication, working on business process documentation and process improvement projects.

Qualifications

  • Analytical Skills and Industrial Engineering expertise
  • Strong Communication abilities
  • Experience in Real Estate, Property Management, Finance/Accounting Business Process Documentation/Improvement preferred
  • Proven background in Process Improvement
  • Knowledge of Lean Six Sigma methodologies is a plus
  • Bachelor&aposs degree in Industrial Engineering or related field
  • Relevant certifications such as Six Sigma Green Belt are beneficial

title: Associate Engineer, Industrial Engineering
job_desc:
Come join Analog Devices (ADI) a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare.

ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future.

About Analog Devices

Analog Devices, Inc. (NASDAQ: ADI ) is a global semiconductor leader that bridges the physical and digital worlds to enable breakthroughs at the Intelligent Edge. ADI combines analog, digital, and software technologies into solutions that help drive advancements in digitized factories, mobility, and digital healthcare, combat climate change, and reliably connect humans and the world. With revenue of more than $9 billion in FY24 and approximately 24,000 people globally, ADI ensures today&aposs innovators stay Ahead of What&aposs Possible. Learn more at www.analog.com and on LinkedIn and Twitter (X).

  • Review site-specific capacity (tester, handler, prober) and identity/resolve any constraints and shortfalls using constraint, unconstraint supply, and demand, reference to JDA and Supply Health.
  • Crosscheck the utilization rates on the floor for the top running products, and drive/track improvements with production/ engineering/ maintenance and other cross-functional teams.
  • Address UIPH discrepancy provided by IE team to ensure responsible parties resolve the issues and track them to complete.
  • Weekly throughput monitoring and identifying the root causes of low throughput and track resolutions to completion.
  • Track weekly WIP situation and report testers/handlers with high weeks of wip qty. Ensure plan exists to reduce the wip to the required planned level. Measure, identify and track the progress and report if there are any outstanding issues.
  • Track schedules for test platform and product transfers and ensure planning data (TPS/SCP) is updated.
  • Review and resolve zero capacity cells.
  • Manage Load balancing between locations and ensure capacity is in line with needs.
  • Able to drive collaboration meetings with cross functional teams (Factory, IE, OR, etc) and perform project management
  • Able to lead a small group (if opportunity is available)

For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. As such, applicants for this position except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) may have to go through an export licensing review process.

Analog Devices is an equal opportunity employer. We foster a culture where everyone has an opportunity to succeed regardless of their race, color, religion, age, ancestry, national origin, social or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran status, union membership, and political affiliation, or any other legally protected group.

Job Req Type: Graduate Job

Required Travel: No
